qas.question: What was Brazil's argument against the US cotton industry?
What are the African countries of Benin, Burkina Faso, Chad, and Mali referred to as in the cotton industry?
What has the Cotton-4 been in regards to the US cotton subsidies?
What could the US do that would please the foreign cotton industry concerning cotton subsidies?
What organization has Brazil tried to use to curb US cotton subsidies?
What was Brazil's argument against Chad's cotton industry?
What has the Cotton-4 been in regards to the cotton industry?
What could the US do that would please the WTO concerning cotton subsidies?
What organization has the US tried to use to curb Brazilian subsidies?

context: While Brazil was fighting the US through the <a4_0><b8_0>WTO's Dispute Settlement Mechanism<b8_0/><a4_0/> against a <a0_0><b5_0>heavily subsidized<b5_0/><a0_0/> cotton industry, a group of four least-developed African countries – Benin, Burkina Faso, Chad, and Mali – also known as "<a1_0>Cotton-4<a1_0/>" have been the <a2_0><b6_0>leading protagonist<b6_0/><a2_0/> for the <a3_0><b7_0>reduction<b7_0/><a3_0/> of US cotton subsidies through negotiations. The four introduced a "Sectoral Initiative in Favour of Cotton", presented by Burkina Faso's President Blaise Compaoré during the Trade Negotiations Committee on <b9_0>10 June 2003<b9_0/>.
